senses.de: An act of kindness beyond what is due or usual
senses.ex: He did me a big favour by giving me a ride to the airport

Tips.title: Not Obligatory
Tips.description: A favour is kindness without being forced or paid for doing it.
Tips.example: She volunteered to proofread my essay, that was a huge favour.

Tips.title: Unconditional Help
Tips.description: When doing a favour, you should not expect anything in return.
Tips.example: I can house-sit for you as a favour; just enjoy your vacation!

Tips.title: Gratitude Expression
Tips.description: It's polite to thank someone who grants you a favour.
Tips.example: Thanks for picking up my mail - I owe you a favour.

senses.de: A small gift or token given as a sign of goodwill or friendship
senses.ex: The host gave out party favours as the guests left

Tips.title: Token Reminder
Tips.description: Party favours are mementos, often from special events or celebrations.
Tips.example: Each guest received a keychain as a wedding favour.

Tips.title: Small Items
Tips.description: Favours tend to be inexpensive or symbolic, not lavish gifts.
Tips.example: Children were thrilled to get balloon animals as party favours.

senses.de: To prefer something over other alternatives
senses.ex: I favour chocolate ice cream over vanilla

Tips.title: Choice Preference
Tips.description: To favour something means you like it more than other options.
Tips.example: In the survey, more people seem to favour summer over winter.

Tips.title: Subtle Support
Tips.description: Favouring can be quiet support, not always openly declared.
Tips.example: The boss seems to favour a relaxed dress code subtly.

senses.de: Approval, support, or liking for someone or something
senses.ex: The proposal has won the favour of the mayor

Tips.title: Approval Gained
Tips.description: Winning someone's favour often involves impressing them.
Tips.example: The new plan gained the favour of most community members.

Tips.title: Loyalty Shift
Tips.description: People may compete to gain or keep someone’s favour.
Tips.example: The contestants tried various ways to win the judge's favour.

senses.de: To treat gently or carefully because of injury or illness
senses.ex: He favoured his injured leg as he walked

Tips.title: Considerate Care
Tips.description: Favouring an injury means being careful to not make it worse.
Tips.example: After the fall, she favoured her sprained ankle while walking.

Advantage.wordDefinition:
Advantage refers to a beneficial or favorable circumstance or condition that helps someone achieve a goal or succeed in something.

It is often related to skills, abilities, resources, money, or opportunities that provide an edge over others. Examples of advantages could be financial stability, having a supportive network, or being naturally talented in a specific area.

Advantage is applicable in situations where one wants to gain an upper hand or edge over others, while a favor is more focused on helping someone out of kindness or gratitude.

Aid.wordDefinition:
Aid refers to providing someone with assistance or support.

It is usually used in situations where someone needs help to achieve a specific goal or overcome an obstacle. For example, if someone needs help with their homework, you can offer to aid them by explaining a difficult concept.

Aid is about helping someone achieve a specific goal, while favour is about doing something nice for someone without a specific aim.

Assistance.wordDefinition:
Assistance refers to helping someone or providing support to someone in need, whereas favour refers to doing something for someone as an act of kindness or goodwill.

Assistance is applicable in situations where someone requires help or support with something specific, such as helping an elderly person carry groceries, or providing assistance to a friend with homework.

Assistance is focused on providing help and support for a specific need, while favour is focused on doing something kind for someone without necessarily being asked to do so.

Benefit.wordDefinition:
Benefit means a positive result gained from something, such as an advantage or improvement.

It can apply to things that are directly advantageous to the person or to society as a whole. Examples of benefits include good health, increased knowledge, and financial gain.

A benefit is something that leads to a positive outcome, while a favour is something done to help someone else out of kindness.

Blessing.wordDefinition:
A blessing is a gift or approval given by a higher power, such as a deity or God.

It is often seen as a form of divine protection or guidance. Blessings are commonly associated with religious or spiritual contexts, such as a priest blessing a church congregation or a person receiving a blessing from a religious leader.

In summary, blessings are gifts given by a higher power while favours are helpful acts done by individuals or organizations.

Blessings are primarily associated with religious or spiritual contexts, while favours can occur in any interpersonal relationship.

Convenience.wordDefinition:
Convenience refers to something that is easy or helpful to have or do. For example, a convenience store is a place where you can quickly and easily purchase basic necessities like food or toiletries.

Convenience is about making things easy or accessible, while favour is about doing something kind or helpful for someone else.

Help.wordDefinition:
Favour and help are two different words that are used to describe different types of actions.

Favors are often something that is not expected or required, and they are given in order to help someone or make them feel better.

Help is a more general term that describes any type of assistance or support that someone may require.

Help can be given in many different forms, such as advice, physical assistance, emotional support, or financial aid.

When someone asks for help, they are usually looking for a specific type of assistance that will help them accomplish a particular task or overcome a particular obstacle.

Favour is used in situations where someone is doing something above and beyond what is expected of them, whereas help is used in situations where someone is providing assistance in order to solve a problem or accomplish a goal.

Kind.wordDefinition:
Kind is more general and can refer to a person's character or actions. If someone is described as kind, it means they are considerate and compassionate towards others.

"Kindness" can refer to any act of compassion or generosity, such as helping a stranger in need or simply being polite to someone.

So, while favour implies a specific request or action, kind refers to a general character trait or behavior.

Support.wordDefinition:
Support means to assist, encourage, or promote someone or something. It suggests active help, aid or assistance.

For example: "I support my friends in their goals and dreams."

Favour expresses personal preference or liking, while support refers to active assistance or promotion.

quotes.Text: I go on giving interviews because I've been brought up to support the projects I'm involved in. When you've enjoyed working on a production, you want to do them a favour.
quotes.Title: English Actress
quotes.Name: Francesca Annis

quotes.Text: I'm not good at raising money. I don't like to raise money. It's been my experience that when I ask someone for money, it's not long before they return the favor.
quotes.Title: American Writer
quotes.Name: John Grisham

quotes.Text: I am, on principle, opposed to war and in favor of peace because I regard peace as a positive good and war as a positive evil.
quotes.Title: American Statesman
quotes.Name: John C. Calhoun

quotes.Text: One must never forget that life is unfair. But sometimes, with a bit of luck, this works in your favour.
quotes.Title: British Author
quotes.Name: Peter Mayle

quotes.Text: Most of the change we think we see in life is due to truths being in and out of favor.
quotes.Title: American Poet
quotes.Name: Robert Frost

quotes.Text: When something is important enough, you do it even if the odds are not in your favor.
quotes.Title: South African Businessman
quotes.Name: Elon Musk

quotes.Text: Fortune always favors the brave, and never helps a man who does not help himself.
quotes.Title: American Entertainer
quotes.Name: P. T. Barnum

quotes.Text: The man who has gotten everything he wants is all in favor of peace and order.
quotes.Title: Indian Leader
quotes.Name: Jawaharlal Nehru

quotes.Text: I know the world isn't fair, but why isn't it ever unfair in my favor?
quotes.Title: American Cartoonist
quotes.Name: Bill Watterson

quotes.Text: I never came into life with any favours or privileges.
quotes.Title: English Politician
quotes.Name: Ken Livingstone
